intro: Nemorinia flavescens, commonly known as the yellow-leafed shrub, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and its ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and often branched. Nemorinia flavescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
